page.title: 08Gaer Fawr woods (cont.)
page.content: Oak and Ash to become established.The wood provides excellent habitats for bird and wild life to flourish.The summit of the wood was originally the site of a Hill Fort.All that remains now is a series of ditches.The trust were provided with a grant to protect this very fort.Some of the trees will have to be removed to prevent the roots destroying the ancient remains. There is a small car park near to a stone quarry where various walks begin.We found these walks very enjoyable,especially on a warm summer's day.The car park is a good spot for discovering fossils, especially ammonites.Approximately ten woodland wardens have been appointed to protect the wood,and to plan for the future.This is in fact,the only spot within the block suitable for purposes of tourism.
